remarks: The join of a poset commutes.  (The antecedent ` <. X , Y >. e. dom .\/ /\ <. Y , X >. e. dom .\/ ` i.e.  "the joins exist" could be omitted as an artifact of our particular join definition, but other definitions may require it.)  (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-2011.)  (Revised by NM, 12-Sep-2018.)
statement:
joincom.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
joincom.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
joincom $p |- ( ( ( K e. Poset /\ X e. B /\ Y e. B ) /\ ( <. X , Y >. e. dom .\/ /\ <. Y , X >. e. dom .\/ ) ) -> ( X .\/ Y ) = ( Y .\/ X ) ) $.
